page.title: 03LANDSCAPE (HIGHER GROUND)
page.content:
MOORLAND. The higher slopes of the moors are moorland, rocky hill areas of rough grass and bracken, with a covering of heath and bilberry bushes and a sprinkling of gorse.
MARSH. In the hill regions there are frequent patches of marshy bog land, where streams run from the higher ground, and the water accumulates in hollows, here the grass is a richer green, bordered by the dark green of the reeds.
WATER. On the eastern slopes of the mountain range, in the area between Moel Dywyll and Moel Famau, the natural streams have been dammed in a series of reservoirs.
